match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 16 balls remaining)

ground.name: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota
ground.longName: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium, Sooriyawewa, Hambantota

match.hoursInfo: 09.45 start, First Session 09.45-13.15, Interval 13.15-14.00, Second Session 14.00-17.30

otherSerieses.name: SL v ZIM ODIs
otherSerieses.longName: Zimbabwe in Sri Lanka ODI Series

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Pradeep b de Silva 111 (98b 15x4 1x6 152m) SR: 113.26

dismissalComment.html: finds deep square leg with a lofted sweep. The shot was on. It was full, it was at middle stump, and there was a big gap behind square on the leg side. He took it on, like a man on 111 should. But Pradeep ran nicely to his right, most of it backwards, and composed himself nicely to hold on

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tarisai Musakanda c Tharanga b Gunaratne 48 (57b 4x4 1x6 88m) SR: 84.21

dismissalComment.html: heaves it into the wind.... and straight to long-on! He had a fifty for the taking, but in going for quick runs, in trying to keep Sri Lanka under the pump, he's given his wicket away. Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: heaves it into the wind.... and straight to long-on! He had a fifty for the taking, but in going for quick runs, in trying to keep Sri Lanka under the pump, he's given his wicket away. Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end

walks across the stumps, shows all of them and looks to ramps this fine. Questionable choice given Gunaratne's pace, but he's constantly been trying to hit him behind square. This is a good length ball and it crashes into the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: finds deep square leg with a lofted sweep. The shot was on. It was full, it was at middle stump, and there was a big gap behind square on the leg side. He took it on, like a man on 111 should. But Pradeep ran nicely to his right, most of it backwards, and composed himself nicely to hold on

goes for the sweep and misses...and the umpire's given it! It strikes him on leg stump and it's very full. Doesn't look out on first glance but it's been given. They have reviewed. This looks like it has marginally pitched in line. It's a slider from the bowler, so it's not spinning down a long way. In slow-mo, I reckon it will be umpire's call. In fact, it's hitting leg stump comfortably. It's not called umpire's call, technically, but the umpire's call was perfect. Good decision.

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire lbw b Pradeep 13 (21b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: there it is. Gets it right up to the batsman, keeps his line and angle intact. No feet from Mire once more. Plays with an angled bat and he's struck right in front of middle and off. Plumb in front.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end

They have reviewed. This looks like it has marginally pitched in line. It's a slider from the bowler, so it's not spinning down a long way. In slow-mo, I reckon it will be umpire's call. In fact, it's hitting leg stump comfortably. It's not called umpire's call, technically, but the umpire's call was perfect. Good decision.

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Gunaratne 43 (47b 2x4 0x6 51m) SR: 91.48

dismissalComment.html: walks across the stumps, shows all of them and looks to ramps this fine. Questionable choice given Gunaratne's pace, but he's constantly been trying to hit him behind square. This is a good length ball and it crashes into the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller lbw b Malinga 17 (24b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 70.83

dismissalComment.html: rolls his fingers on the low full toss, gets it at middle stump. Waller walks across to try and flick this behind square. Misses big time. Full toss on the pads in front of middle stump and even in this match, that is out

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor c Mendis b Sandakan 24 (11b 2x4 2x6 12m) SR: 218.18

dismissalComment.html: can't beat the wind this time. He got good bat on this slog to an overpitched ball on leg stump. But you could see the ball struggling to travel. Hangs and hangs and hangs, then sits neatly in long-on's grasp

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer run out (Sandakan) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: back of a length outside off, looks to push it it into the leg side but there isn't enough turn. It's pushed back down the pitch...and for some reason, Cremer has run down the pitch. Aimless. Sandakan picks up, runs back, and Cremer has to go for none off none

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka b Williams 116 (111b 15x4 1x6 153m) SR: 104.5

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! What a weird few minutes of play! This is a good length ball - nothing too difficult about it - and yet Gunathilaka acts as he's been struck dumb. Just lets it come on. Chops it timidly and it deflects onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Niroshan Dickwella c Williams b Waller 102 (116b 14x4 0x6 148m) SR: 87.93

dismissalComment.html: oh, he's swept it to backward square leg! Waller's done it for Zimbabwe - after 37 overs, and 229 runs, they have their first wicket in this game. Dickwella goes, execution failing him for the shot was on, with the fielders inside the circle

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: there it is. Only the second chase of 300 ever in Sri Lanka and both have come in this series. Tharanga wraps it up with a pull - indicative of the lengths Zimbabwe have insisted on bowling on this flat pitch, those tactics need to be looked at - and stays not out for the third innings in a row

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all we have for you from this game. Catch up with Andrew Fernando's report here, or the Test between SA and England here. But other than that, see ya.

"It was a fantastic effort by the boys. After losing the first game, we had our backs against the ball and we came back well," Angelo Mathews says, "Hamilton played briliantly, credit to him, but we came back very well to keep them to 310. Danushka and Dickwella batted brilliantly and after they gout out, Upul took us home. We can't thank him enough, he's been up and down the order for many years. Here he gave his place to the others to open and he is still scoring runs"

"I thought we had enough runs on the board," says Graeme Cremer, the Zimbabwe captian, "We might have slowed down between 30 to 40, but we picked it up after that. It was a good wicket, and the openers did take the game away from us. Didn't help that we dropped a few chances. Didn't start well with the ball either. We need to get runs on the board batting first, but 310 was enough, we just need to get better with the field. Our bowling was probably under par as well"

"I just played my normal game. Credit goes to Dickwella, he played a brilliant knock," says Gunathilaka, the Man of the Match, says "It was a great wicket to bat and we knew if we played out natural game, we could get it easily. Credit goes to the bowlers, it was a hard wicket ot bowl. They did really well"

"Great feeling to get my first hundred," Dickwella says. "Playing in Sri Lanka, making my first century in front of our crowd is a great feeling. Great privilege batting with Gunathilaka as well. We just wanted to keep the run-rate under 6 and 6.5. We were just batting out the overs, not talking much, not thinking much. [Is that your best knock?] Not really, not up to my standards. I just want to make my country proud and make it easy for the team. I was counting my runs from 90, and I asked Gunathilaka if I was on 99 or 98 and he said, you were on 99 [he was on 98], I'm sure. So when I got a single next ball, I started celebrating."
5.35 pm This is the match Angelo Mathews has waited all his career for: to put his feet up in the dressing room all innings while his boys go out and hunt down 300-plus.

Especially after your bowlers took 25 minutes longer to finish their innings. This game has finished nearly on time with the batsmen picking up the slack beautifully. Niroshan Dickwella, with his whiplash hands, and Danushka Gunathilaka, with his sheer power, put on a double-century opening stand. What more do you want in a 300 chase? Zimbabwe just couldn't find a way past them, and when they did, their fielders let them down, dropping catches

So Hamilton Masakadza's fifth ODI ton was in vain. He played a superb innings, hitting straight more often than not and timing it beautifully too. Many of his shots were hit with the wind too. But he fell in the 33rd over, and there after Zimbabwe's scoring slumped. They probably finished 30-40 runs short. That's saying something considering Nuwan Pradeep, who had looked Sri Lanka's best bowler in the six overs he could get through, had to leave the field with some kind of leg injury. Stepping up for him were offspinner Aesla Gunaratne and legspinner Wanindu Hasaranga. Four wickets between them for 97 runs in 17 overs.

commentTextItems.html: back of a length ball, lets it go.
slower short ball on off stump, pulls it to deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: continues digging into his own half, Tharanga continues to let them all go, and it's been called a wide for height
avoids the attempted bouncer on leg stump
hits into the breeze, and so the ball just holds up in the air, and plop on the ground about two-thirds of the way to the midwicket boundary
ducks under the short ball from around the wicket
allows a short ball to stroll away over his right shoulder and become a wide
guides a shortish delivery to point

commentPostTextItems.html: Roshan Indika: "After 02 years time we have been at Hambanthota sooriyawewa stadium...600 more runs scored today. What a pitch this has been"

commentPreTextItems.html: Qaaid Mowlana: "Tharanga has really matured in the last year, not long ago his average was languishing in the low 30s, it's now around 35, a sign of improving consistency. After so many years of frustration, he's finally rewarding everyone for their faith in him "

commentTextItems.html: shortish and outside off, sent away to the sweeper
meets the short ball under his eyes and pulls it to deep midwicket.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Tharaka Jasenth: "How cool is Upul Tharanga? He is yet to be dismissed this series, and has already scored 184 runs. Fabulous!"

commentTextItems.html: launches a short ball to deep midwicket
shortish, and slow, on off stump, Mendis pulls to deep square leg and Sri Lanka have their 300. The last fifty coming in only 28 balls

commentPreTextItems.html: Solomon Mire to finish the over

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and outside off, pushes it to the right of the sweeper cover

offcutter on off stump, defends. And again, Mumba falls in his followthrough, tripping over his right leg. He keeps doing that because he runs in at an angle into the wickets, and then has to change direction immediately to avoid the danger area.

commentPostTextItems.html: Mumba goes down again! That right knee just collapses as he plants it down on the crease to bowl over it. It's already heavily strapped up, and Mumba is frantically removing all of it. He should really go off here. And he is. Good thing for Zimbabwe though is that he is walking off without any help from the physio.

commentTextItems.html: that's ridiculously easy, he made it look ridiculously easy. Out comes a short ball, well outside off, and Mendis greets it with the gentlest little ramp to the third man boundary
waits in his load-up and then delivers - guess what? - another short ball. Tharanga isn't fooled by such theatrics. Smacks a cut shot through extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Carl Mumba smiles after getting his maiden Test wicket
image.longCaption: Carl Mumba smiles after getting his maiden Test wicket, Zimbabwe v Sri Lanka, 1st Test, Harare, 2nd day, October 30, 2016

headshotImage.caption: Carl Mumba player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carl Mumba player page headshot cutout 2021

commentTextItems.html: races down the pitch and nails a straight drive. Raza does well to move to his left and get two hands on it. But it has so much power that it pings away
flatter delivery, keeps low on off stump, and Tharanga, who's weight is going back and away on leg stump, just about toe-ends it

This looks like it has marginally pitched in line. It's a slider from the bowler, so it's not spinning down a long way. In slow-mo, I reckon it will be umpire's call. In fact, it's hitting leg stump comfortably. It's not called umpire's call, technically, but the umpire's call was perfect. Good decision.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: heaves it into the wind.... and straight to long-on! He had a fifty for the taking, but in going for quick runs, in trying to keep Sri Lanka under the pump, he's given his wicket away. Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end

walks across the stumps, shows all of them and looks to ramps this fine. Questionable choice given Gunaratne's pace, but he's constantly been trying to hit him behind square. This is a good length ball and it crashes into the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Carl Mumba smiles after getting his maiden Test wicket
image.longCaption: Carl Mumba smiles after getting his maiden Test wicket, Zimbabwe v Sri Lanka, 1st Test, Harare, 2nd day, October 30, 2016

headshotImage.caption: Carl Mumba player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carl Mumba player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire lbw b Pradeep 13 (21b 2x4 0x6 35m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: there it is. Gets it right up to the batsman, keeps his line and angle intact. No feet from Mire once more. Plays with an angled bat and he's struck right in front of middle and off. Plumb in front.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tarisai Musakanda c Tharanga b Gunaratne 48 (57b 4x4 1x6 88m) SR: 84.21

dismissalComment.html: heaves it into the wind.... and straight to long-on! He had a fifty for the taking, but in going for quick runs, in trying to keep Sri Lanka under the pump, he's given his wicket away. Good innings - in that he didn't look good at the start, but gutsed it out - comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Pradeep b de Silva 111 (98b 15x4 1x6 152m) SR: 113.26

dismissalComment.html: finds deep square leg with a lofted sweep. The shot was on. It was full, it was at middle stump, and there was a big gap behind square on the leg side. He took it on, like a man on 111 should. But Pradeep ran nicely to his right, most of it backwards, and composed himself nicely to hold on

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine lbw b de Silva 16 (24b 1x4 0x6 42m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: goes for the sweep and misses...and the umpire's given it! It strikes him on leg stump and it's very full. Doesn't look out on first glance but it's been given. They have reviewed. This looks like it has marginally pitched in line. It's a slider from the bowler, so it's not spinning down a long way. In slow-mo, I reckon it will be umpire's call. In fact, it's hitting leg stump comfortably. It's not called umpire's call, technically, but the umpire's call was perfect. Good decision.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Gunaratne 43 (47b 2x4 0x6 51m) SR: 91.48

dismissalComment.html: walks across the stumps, shows all of them and looks to ramps this fine. Questionable choice given Gunaratne's pace, but he's constantly been trying to hit him behind square. This is a good length ball and it crashes into the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller lbw b Malinga 17 (24b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 70.83

dismissalComment.html: rolls his fingers on the low full toss, gets it at middle stump. Waller walks across to try and flick this behind square. Misses big time. Full toss on the pads in front of middle stump and even in this match, that is out

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor c Mendis b Sandakan 24 (11b 2x4 2x6 12m) SR: 218.18

dismissalComment.html: can't beat the wind this time. He got good bat on this slog to an overpitched ball on leg stump. But you could see the ball struggling to travel. Hangs and hangs and hangs, then sits neatly in long-on's grasp

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer run out (Sandakan) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: back of a length outside off, looks to push it it into the leg side but there isn't enough turn. It's pushed back down the pitch...and for some reason, Cremer has run down the pitch. Aimless. Sandakan picks up, runs back, and Cremer has to go for none off none

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Niroshan Dickwella c Williams b Waller 102 (116b 14x4 0x6 148m) SR: 87.93

dismissalComment.html: oh, he's swept it to backward square leg! Waller's done it for Zimbabwe - after 37 overs, and 229 runs, they have their first wicket in this game. Dickwella goes, execution failing him for the shot was on, with the fielders inside the circle

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka b Williams 116 (111b 15x4 1x6 153m) SR: 104.5

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! What a weird few minutes of play! This is a good length ball - nothing too difficult about it - and yet Gunathilaka acts as he's been struck dumb. Just lets it come on. Chops it timidly and it deflects onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis not out 28 (25b 2x4 0x6 54m) SR: 112
Upul Tharanga not out 44 (32b 3x4 2x6 49m) SR: 137.5

stories.title: Gunathilaka, Dickwella thrash Zimbabwe
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.summary: Sri Lanka's openers put on 229 and hit their maiden ODI hundreds in the same match as they hacked down a 300+ target more than two overs to spare
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Hamilton Masakadza slaps one through the leg side
image.longCaption: Hamilton Masakadza slaps one through the leg side, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, July 6, 2017

stories.title: Pitch, crosswind challenges for teams in Hambantota
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Pitch, crosswind challenges for teams in Hambantota
stories.summary: With ODI cricket returning to Hambantota for the first time since 2015, the nature of the pitch for the third ODI between Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe remains a mystery
